step_feedback.feedback: While the attempt to tighten whole body muscles during inhalation is noted,  the significant MAE values in the wrists and elbows suggest inconsistent muscle engagement across repetitions. Focus on engaging all muscle groups equally, not just concentrating on the abdomen. Visualize the fluid moving from your extremities towards your chest.

Hand placement on the abdomen is good. However, the high MAE values, especially in the elbows and wrists, indicate that muscle tightening wasn't consistently maintained throughout the exercise. Remember to keep your muscles engaged throughout the entire inhalation phase.

The visualization technique is crucial. While some muscle engagement is observed, the inconsistent MAE values across repetitions and body parts suggest that the visualization of fluid movement to the chest needs more focus. Try to actively visualize the fluid flow during inhalation.

The relaxation phase is important.  The inconsistent MAE values across repetitions and body parts suggest that complete muscle relaxation during exhalation needs more attention.  Ensure complete relaxation to facilitate the visualization of fluid pushing out.

exercise_summary: The patient demonstrated some understanding of the Deep Breathing exercise, attempting to engage muscles during inhalation and relax during exhalation. However, consistent muscle engagement throughout the exercise and visualization of fluid movement were inconsistent across repetitions and body parts.  Improved focus on muscle control and visualization techniques is needed.
